The talking bag
 Caroline Lentupuru
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon a time there was a female 
 giant. 
 
 As she was walking near the lake one 
 day, she found thre litle girls. 
 She asked them, “Who among you is 
 
 loved by both parents?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One of the girls said, "My mother loves
 me most." 
 Another said, "My father loves me most."
 
 But the third one said, "I am loved by both
 parents." 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The giant then asked the girl loved by 
 
 both parents to help her put a load of 
 firewod on her back. 
 So the girl folowed the giant. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 After going for some distance, the girl
 asked the giant, “Where is your 
 firewod?” 
 
 The giant replied, “It is near those tres
 over there!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When they reached the tres, the girl 
 asked again, “Where is your firewod?” 
 
 The giant answered, “Not far now!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They walked on and met a man. 
 He asked the giant, “What is the name of
 your child?” 
 
 The giant replied, “She is caled the
 ‘talking bag’.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The girl burst out singing: 
 “I am not caled the talking bag. 
 My name is Kamungei! 
 
 Oh! My mother, whom I love, 
 Oh! My father, whom I love, 
 Oh! My calabash, which I use to drink 
 
 milk!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When the man heard what the girl sang,
 he rescued her and tok her back to her
 parents. 
 
 
 The story ends there!
